page.title: 04Farming
page.content: Most of the farms in the area are dairy or arable farms.The size of the farms vary from very small,12 acres to very big 300 acres approx. The area also includes some livestock,pig and beef units. Most of the arable land is for growing cerials. Wheat is sold off the farm, and barley used for home consumption. Crops grown are mainly winter varieties with potatoes as break crops. The forms of farming are dictated by the type of land. Parts are of a heavy nature and therefore suitable for grass growing. The actual Criftins area is known locally as The Bog because of the flooding nature of the land.
